name: SpringHill Suites Dulles Airport

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of a 9 day trip, and the last night of our trip. One of the elevators was out of order all of that time... is it fixed yet? The Front Desk staff are friendly. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and had good variety. The hotel has a large, comfortable breakfast room. For a suite hotel, we wished we could close a door between the sleeping room and the living room, since we have an infant who was sleeping in a crib in the living room, and who we had hoped would go to sleep earlier than us. We draped a blanket on the side of his crib to make it darker. I believe it was difficult to adjust the room's thermostat to a comfortable temperature - I kept tinkering with it. The "room service" dinners available from a nearby pub are very tasty and reasonably priced. We didn't think there was intrusive airport noise. The hotel is isolated from other businesses. We think we lost our baby's noise-reducing headphones in our first hotel room here, but the hotel claimed they didn't find them.
reviews.title: Pretty good stay

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times and I really do like it. They have nice, clean rooms and a well-maintained facility. I saw them cleaning windows and vacuuming regularly in the public areas. Staff is friendly and seems to be efficient.
reviews.title: Nice facilities

reviews.text: They have a very nice indoor pool and a whirlpool next to it. Towels are on every chair and also stacked nearby. They do not have a changing room but there is a restroom close to the entrance door and they have a stairway entrance to the pool area so you can avoid the lobby when you come into or out of the pool area.
reviews.title: Excellent Location Facilities and Staff

reviews.text: Another nice amenity is a paved pathway with benches that goes around the property. There is also a good-sized basketball court.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: My only complaint about this hotel is the eggs they serve at breakfast. They are not very good and are served in squares so it looks like they are frozen beforehand. The rest of the breakfast is fine and a nice selection is available.
reviews.title: Inviting, Clean, Friendly

reviews.text: These are not suites, to be able to call it a suite, it must have a kitchen. A mini fridge and microwave doesn't constitute a kitchen. there are no cooking utinsiles. a coffee pot that makes less than a cup of coffee at a time. the micro mini fridge does not even have a freezer. I was led to beleive these are suites but are NOT. they also advertise that they have omelets for breakfast but DO NOT. the so called breakfast buffett is nothing more than a continintal offering.
reviews.title: these are not suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night before an early morning airport pick-up. The hotel is only a 10 minute ride to Dulles, and offers free shuttle service as well. The hotel was very nice, very clean, and very quiet considering its proximity to Dulles. The room was the typical SHS room-bed area, sitting area, large flat screen TV(could use a few more channels), micro/refrig, sink. Nice bathroom, good water pressure.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: As others have said, there really isn't anywhere to eat nearby, so factor that in if you don't have a car.
reviews.title: FLYING OUT OF DULLES WAS CHEAPER THAN FLYING OUT OF RICHMOND

reviews.text: The only negative.... Something happened to the indoor pool/whirlpool a few days before we arrived, so it was unexpectedly closed(was looking forward to a soak in the whirlpool). To the hotels credit, when I asked about it, I was offered a ride down the street to their sister hotel, the Hampton, to use theirs. Didn't take them up on it, but the offer was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Hotels in and around Dulles/DC are very pricy, especially during the week, so it wasn't any great bargain staying on a Wednesday. However, I would stay again if needing to be near Dulles
reviews.title: one nighted in Dulles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got this hotel at a good price as 'mystery' hotel and was very pleased to have done so. Good room, comfortable beds and no aircraft noise. Helpful front desk staff arranged to take us to car rental location after an above average 'complimentary' breakfast. What more to need?
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.text: Recommended unreservedly.
reviews.title: Excellent layover

reviews.text: Everything about our stay was terrific, but too short. The room was huge and spotless, the staff was friendly and helpful, the full hot breakfast was very, very satisfying.
reviews.title: Great Dulles stopover

reviews.text: Tanu at front desk is amazing! She was so courteous and informative. She made terrific suggestions for food and made every effort to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. First class Tanu!
reviews.title: Great hotel near airport

reviews.text: Top notch hotel for under $100. New, clean and staff all very courteous and willing to answer questions with a smile. Free breakfast with hot food choices very good. Great indoor pool & hot tub area where our teenagers did not want to leave. Spacious, immaculate rooms with mini fridge and microwave with a semi-private living room with pull out couch and chair. Wireless internet fast and efficient. Outdoor patio with gas grill a nice touch. Also offered a basketball court and putting green for the kids. Highly recommend nearby air & space museum. Only about 30 min trip to DC. Park and ride at the Metro station in nearby Vienna the best bet. Will return.
reviews.title: Great for park and fly

reviews.text: Stayed here three nights with a tour group of 30+ senior citizens. Rooms were exceptional, great layout with spacious floorplan. Housekeeping was outstanding. Room cleanliness was one of the best I've ever experienced. Bed was very comfortable, and the air conditioning performed extremely well during the recent heat-way with temperatures over 100 degrees outside.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, great layout & very clean, but very crowded loby, business center, overrun by teen tour groups

reviews.text: Given the location, it is not surprising that there are a lot of tour groups staying here (I was there as part of a tour group). And, the hotel did do a good job of keeping the youth / school tour groups bed rooms on a different floor from the senior group.
reviews.title: Clean Rooms and Free Breafast..WOW!!!!

reviews.text: The breakfast selection was good, and the staff tried to keep up with resupplying the food given the hordes of people. The problem was that the teen groups totally monopolized the one relatively small area (for the size of the hotel) to eat breakfast. The hotel desperately needs more space for places to eat breakfast; maybe separate rooms for the tours. Most of our tour group gave up and just carried breakfast coffee and food back to our rooms.
reviews.title: A great stayover spot while visiting Washington DC

reviews.text: My only complaint is the crowds of unrully youth groups, and the hotel's inability to cope with this influx. The hotel offers three PCs in their business center. Although there was a sign up indicating that the PCs were only for individuals over the age of 18, the youth groups totally monopolized the computers. Even though the business center is directly accross from the front desk, and the front desk could see the kids (several kids deep) crowded around the PCs, the front desk did nothing to rectify the situation and enforce their own policy.
reviews.title: Great value, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one morning the loby area became a very loud, mob scene of teenagers, and the rest of us had to struggle to walk through there. Although I recognize that the hotel should not be responsible for the bad behavior of the kids (their adult supervision appeared non-existent), I lowered the rating of the hotel from Excellent to Poor because they did not set up separate eating areas for the tour groups and did not enforce their own policy of limiting computer access in the business area to adults only.
reviews.title: Good place to stay near Dulles

aka: Springhill Suites Dulles Airport Hotel Sterling
description: Welcome to the Marriott SpringHill Suites at Washington Dulles Airport, your ideal choice for Dulles Airport hotels. The Marriott Dulles SpringHill Suites is the newest all suite hotel in Sterling, VA. The Marriott SpringHill Suites Dulles Airport features a fabulous location just minutes from Washington Dulles International Airport. The SpringHill Suites Dulles is also conveniently located near Downtown Washington D.C., Dulles Town Center Mall, Leesburg Outlet Shopping.
